question_text: An IT team is evaluating NFC for use in secure logins. Which of the following is a key security limitation of NFC that must be considered?
answer_options: It requires encryption keys to be shared over email
It cannot be used indoors due to signal reflection
It is vulnerable to relay attacks if not combined with authentication
It uses visible light, which can be intercepted easily
correct_answer: It is vulnerable to relay attacks if not combined with authentication
explanation: Although NFC is short-range, it can be exploited via relay attacks if proper identity verification (e.g., PIN or biometric) isn't also used.
